column4: I ran the commands you suggested. Should I now try and reinstall unity?
just logout and then login
unity now claims that i do not have the hardware to run it :( it's put me onto Ubuntu Classic
do you know what kind of graphics card you have? if not run lspci in a terminal and it should say
VGA compatible controller: ATI Technologies Inc Mobility Radeon HD 3400 Series - it worked fine before today
glxinfo only outputs "name of display: :0.0"

so you don't have glx. for ati you have two options. one is the amd driver the other is something called radeonhd. the amd driver has better performance and the radeonhd is open source if you want to open up the hardware drivers you might be able to install one of them
are both the amd and radeonhd drivers available in the software-center?
yes you should be able to find the amd in additional drivers. the radeonhd is in software center/synaptic
apparently ATI Radeon X.Org Driver is already installed
thats probably radeonhd. its possible you have two things installed and they are conflicting. cant you !paste your /var/log/Xorg.0.log
http://paste.ubuntu.com/625252/
that shows you using fglrx which are the amd drivers. i don't know why you wouldn't have glx. I would go into additional drivers and try to reinstall/reenable the amd drivers
i'd be grateful for step-by-step instructions on how to re-install them - having difficulty finding out
try sudo apt-get remove fglrx; sudo apt-get install fglrx
thank you! now I logout and try again?
yeah. hopefully it works
it's defaulting to classic mode despite selecting ubuntu :/
im not sure why your glx isn't working. it seems like X is using fglrx, perhaps check what ls -l /usr/lib/libGL* says
http://paste.ubuntu.com/625269/
I'm afraid I just don't know what to look for. I think the problem may be that your libgl is the mesa libgl but your driver is the amd fglrx, but I don't know how to fix it
don't worry about it :) I appreciate you trying to help! definitely the last time i muck about with compiz though, lol
I think on logout it may not have been restarting X
so it didnt catch the new driver
